fontTheory.description: The typography system aims to balance readability and hierarchy by utilizing a mix of serif and sans-serif fonts with distinct characteristics.
fontTheory.readability: The chosen fonts prioritize readability by combining serif and sans-serif options suitable for different text sizes and screen resolutions.
fontTheory.hierarchy: The typographic hierarchy is established through font weights, sizes, and styles to create visual distinctions between headings, body text, titles, and other elements.
fontTheory.fontPairings: The selected fonts complement each other by offering a harmonious blend of traditional and modern styles, enhancing the document's overall aesthetic.
